sources.title: South of Monterey (1946) THE CISCO KIDüçï GILBERT ROLAND
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars: Gilbert Roland, Marjorie Riordan
Director: William Nigh

The Cisco Kid sets out to rescue a girl from forsaking her true love and catch the outlaws that robbed a stage carrying gold for the Mission. 

TRIVIA: The Cisco Kid is a fictional character created by O. Henry for his short story "The Caballero's Way," first published in 1907. Four actors portrayed this Western hero in 25 films during the sound era. In 1928 the first all-talking western starred Warner Baxter as the Cisco Kid, followed by Cesar Romero, Duncan Renaldo, and Gilbert Roland.

metadata.Plot: The Cisco Kid (Gilbert Roland) hears of a land-swindling scheme devised by the police Commandante (Martin Garralaga) and the tax collector (Harry Woods) in a small western town. Cisco's efforts against the plot cause the thieves to fall out, and Cisco is able to return the land to the rightful owners.
metadata.Actors: Gilbert Roland, Martin Garralaga, Frank Yaconelli
